column5: I am going to fish a couple Barbless hook lakes in Ontario this spring. I was wondering if the baitkeeper tangs on certain Jig heads can be counted as a barb? For example the C&S H2O Jigs have a large keeper that is basically a barb. I just dont want to run into any trouble with a Co

From the Rules Using Fishing Tackle page of the Ontario.ca website: Barbless hooka hook made without a barba hook with its barb completely removeda hook with its barb flattened against the shaft of the hook This addresses only the barb on the point of the hook and says nothing about the bait keeper which is on the shank. I can't imagine that would be an issue.
that baitkeeper on that jig is fine. it does not enter the fishes jaw and does not make it more difficult to remove a hooked fish. its sole purpose is to hold a soft plastic bait up on the jig.
I thought all lakes in Canada where barbless? What have I been doing!!!!! Paul
Not the case. Manitoba is barbless, but for the most part, Ontario is not unless otherwise noted. For example, I believe Nipigon is barbless. I'm sure there are others.
